name: Katherine Robinson
bio: Katherine Robinson earned a BA from Amherst College, an MFA from The Writing Seminars at Johns Hopkins University. Her poetry and fiction have appeared in The Kenyon Review, The Hudson Review, Poet Lore, The Common and elsewhere. Her critical interests include the influence of mythology and bardic poetry on contemporary poetics, especially in the work of Ted Hughes, and her essays have been published in Ploughshares and The Ted Hughes Society Journal. She is pursing a post-graduate degree at Cambridge University as a Gates Cambridge Scholar.
